member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.AddEMPVResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds tags to the specified resource. You can specify one or more tags to add.

summary.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource. You can get this from the response to any request to the resource.
A collection of tags associated with a resource

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.AddEMPVResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.AddEMPVResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.AddEMPVResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a description of a MediaPackage VOD Asset resource.

summary.para: The ID of an MediaPackage VOD Asset resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DescribeAssetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.DescribeAssetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Id parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Id' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetListCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns a collection of MediaPackage VOD Asset resources.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

summary.para: Returns Assets associated with the specified PackagingGroup.
Upper bound on number of records to return.

Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.
A token used to resume pagination from the end of a previous request.

Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Assets'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.ListAssetsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaPackageVod.Model.ListAssetsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the PackagingGroupId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^PackagingGroupId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.EMPV.GetEMPVAssetListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
